direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Drying himself) Yes, come in! Not giving him time to get dressed, Harry hands him the notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luis, the editor, sent it to me six years ago. At that time I didn't even bother to open it, I didn't want to know anything about him. I am now thinking
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: that perhaps he had something to tell me. Would you mind seeing if beyond the takes and all of that there is something else written? Diego looks through it carefully. The last pages are empty. The rest only have the numbers pertaining to the sequences, the shots, and the selected takes, like we have seen in the sequence with the Moviola. Although, there is something written on the last page. "My new number: 91 6994079."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the end he says this is my new number, a number's written down. Harry hands him his mobile phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call him, please!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right now? It's too early.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't matter. Diego dials the number and hands the phone to Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I get dressed? I'm naked...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm sorry. He turns around and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HARRY'S HOME. DEN. INT. DAY. 2008. He exits the bedroom and heads for his dark den.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (On the phone) Could I speak to Luis, please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Surprised) Luis died six years ago!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I am so sorry... I had no idea!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was cancer. I'm his widow. Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mateo Blanco. Luis edited all my films...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (More serene) Mateo Blanco! Luis spoke to me about you. I am his second wife...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one I know is Nieves, the first one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We married twelve years ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Sincere and sorrowful) I am sorry to hear about Luis' death. I would have liked to speak to him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He would have liked so too! Once he was quite ill and didn't want to speak to anyone, he would always tell me that, if it was you, I should hand him the phone... Harry keeps silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have no idea how sorry I am! Cut to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM, HARRY'S HOME. INT. DAY. 2008. Diego is in the kitchen. He is preparing breakfast, both for himself and Mateo. Harry, heavy-hearted, approaches the kitchen, pensive. A half-hearted "happy birthday" escapes Diego's lips. Harry doesn't react, perhaps he hasn't heard him. Noticing the look on his face Diego is not eager to insist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My editor. I just found out he died six years ago... Diego remains silent and lets Harry continue talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not long before he died he sent me this notebook. But I didn't want to know anything about him, I also didn't know he was dying... and I put it away... until today... His wife just told me he would have liked to speak to me, that was the purpose of sending me the notebook... but I didn't give him the chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Had you spoken since the accident?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Never. Diego places plates with toast and juice on the table. He serves Harry some coffee and adds sugar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The coffee is in front of you... Harry finds the cup easily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you OK? Would you like me to stay here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no... You're heading out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mother arrives today. I would like to be home when she arrives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know she was arriving...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't either, she left me a message this morning. She's coming to celebrate your birthday, with us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my birthday?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It seems so. Today's the (he tells him the day), does that sound right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. A day like today, fifty-one years ago, I entered the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy birthday!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JUDIT AND DIEGO'S HOME. INT. DAY. 2008. Judit returns from location scouting. She enters her house. She hugs her son, effusively. She drops a large suitcase, with wheels. (The sequence takes place in various rooms in the house. From the foyer she should move toward the bedroom or the kitchen, where she makes herself some tea, or where she opens bags full of food that she's brought, typical to the region she's just visited. (She looks inside the refrigerator and doesn't find anything). Things like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was dying to see you! Are you OK, my son?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was very worried about you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mateo has looked after me day and night...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mateo? You're not calling him Harry...? Diego had not realized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Today's his birthday, we must get him something... What have you been up to all this time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing... Watching movies... and talking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (As if it were something strange) Talking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, please! Judit looks at her son. She finds him different. As if all the confidences shared with Harry had left a physical and visible mark on him. Diego seems to guess what his mother is thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . So what happened to you? (Sort of joking) I don't know if I should believe the thing about the stomach flu, you two used that as an excuse in a script...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Elusive) (I suffered) ... an accident. But I would rather not speak of that right now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Irritated, by the surprise) What kind of accident?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's hard to explain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Orders him, annoyed) Try to! I am not that stupid!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's leave it for another time, yes? I am all well now. Judit gets the sense that she can no longer speak to her son in the same way that she could before she left on her trip. Those two weeks have irreversibly changed him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with you, Diego?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. I'm doing just fine. I'm going to buy a present for Mateo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Repeats) For Mateo...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, Harry. (Offended, she doesn't want her son to think she is a drag, so she makes an effort not to bombard him with questions)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call him however you wish. That's the advantage of having two names. Diego disappears and leaves her in mid-sentence. (Is this his way of avenging himself? Perhaps his reaction is unfair, but he cannot stand to stay there with his mother, answering thousands of questions regarding an "accident" when there has been another "accident" that he is much more intrigued by and that she has kept silent for fourteen years.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MATEO-HARRY'S HOME. INT. DAY. 2008.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (The maid may be around) Mateo goes to open the door. Judit has the key in one hand and a huge flower bouquet in the other. They greet each other enthusiastically. Mateo-Harry attempts to hug her but his arms collide with the flowers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, my arms are full...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are those flowers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! Happy Birthday! Cut to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MATEO-HARRY'S HOME. INT. DAY. 2008. Mateo and Judit talk, they are sitting on a sofa, the conversation is already mid-way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you for looking after Diego... I don't know how to thank you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've been looking after me for fourteen years now... Judit brushes his acknowledgement off, with a half-smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've found him somewhat hostile. He left without telling me what it was that happened... Will you tell me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. It should be your son to tell you. Judit is upset by both of their evasiveness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is wrong with the two of you? Why is it that he suddenly is not calling you Harry but Mateo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (He evades the first question, but responds to the second one.) Two weeks ago, at the place where he D.J.'s, by mistake, he grabbed a friend's drink that had been spiked with G.H.B., liquid ecstasy. He thought it was his drink, both drinks had Coca-cola.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Liquid ecstasy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. It's a very dangerous drug when it's mixed with alcohol and Diego had already had two Cuba Libres before he drank from his friend's glass...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And... what happened... exactly?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Being vague.) He was badly affected. He spent two days in urgent care, after that, I brought him here. Judit looks at him, horrified. She can't seem to comprehend such a turbulent and simple story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diego's a drug addict?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I've told you, he drank from the glass containing liquid ecstasy by mistake...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But how can one make a mistake with something like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At first glace one cannot tell the difference. Both glasses contained Coca-cola... It's not the first time it happens... Judit sighs, defenseless and horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diego has not told you so that you wouldn't be alarmed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (That I wouldn't be alarmed?!) Well, he hasn't succeeded. At some point he will have to speak to me, no?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is wanting to do so! Judit takes a cigarette out of its box and lights it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that so? Because I ask him and he doesn't answer!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you should try answering him, when he asks you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judit smokes in silence, she is curious to know what Mateo and Diego have been talking about in her absence, but she doesn't dare ask Mateo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two of you are acting very differently. Both of you. You both have changed. She laments it, as if she had been put aside and they had not taken her into account. Cut to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . "NO VIEWS" RESTAURANT. INT. NIGHT. 2008.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Judit and Mateo are having something to drink. Mateo tilts his head subtly in front of Judit.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AT THE BAR BEFORE ONE ENTERS THE RESTAURANT

direction.raw_text: You smell good...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Insecure) I have put on some makeup and I am dressed as a woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the dress like? Judit describes it, with few words and almost shyly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the hair? How are you wearing your hair? It's been so long since I've asked you that I don't even know whether it's long or short. The fact that Mateo betrays that type of interest flatters and disconcerts her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't changed much, Harry. I am wearing my hair short.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Short like Jean Seberg in "Breathless"? Like Joan of Arc on the bonfire? Like Liza Minnelli in "Cabaret"? Or like Yul Brynner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Short, or rather, very short, like that of all fortysomethings who want to appear younger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am sure it looks good on you. Thanks for dressing up for me, Judit... Diego looks at them, amused. He hands Mateo three DVDs (Scorsese's "Goodfellas" (or the Coen Brother's "Fargo"), Tarantino's "Kill Bill," and Kiarostami's "Taste of Cherry"). Near them, on the bar table, two couples talk excitedly as if they were about to go on a ride at an Amusement Park. The barman tells them they may now enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . "NO VIEWS" RESTAURANT. INT. NIGHT. 2008.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once they've crossed the doorway, a man signals them to follow him. He's a blind man that, like Mateo, moves smoothly, he knows the place by heart. The restaurant is completely shrouded in darkness, all the waiters, men and women, are blind. The one in charge of Mateo, Diego, and Judit introduces himself:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Javier. How many are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three. There is not a single light inside. The following sequences take place in absolute darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, grab onto each other's shoulders and follow me in Indian-file. I will guide you to your table. It's number eight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is the idea here, Harry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are dinning in darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't know this, ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Anxious, feeling slightly ridiculed) No...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should have been warned, but don't worry. People get used to it after a few minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . "NO VIEWS" RESTAURANT. INT. NIGHT. 2008. They have arrived to their table, as signaled by the waiter. Table number eight. He tells them where to sit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imagine that your plate is the face of a watch. Your silverware is at 9h and at 3h. Your glass at 1h. Bread at 11h. Each of them reaches for the objects as indicated by the waiter around an imaginary clock. Judit still believes this is some kind of joke and that the lights will come on at any moment and that something spectacular will appear before her eyes. If she had been able to see, she would have been witness to the very interesting scenes surrounding her. Two couples kissing, with bestial enjoyment. And a well-bred woman performing fellatio on the man sitting next to her. No one sees them except our camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry, what is all this about? The waiter responds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We want our clients to discover that the lack of sight harnesses the other senses. Touch, taste, smell and sound will acquire a special intensity tonight, ma'am. I hope you'll enjoy them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judit says nothing. She hides her nervousness in order not to ruin Mateo's night, he seems fascinated with the place and completely unaware of the process she is now living: the discovery of absolute darkness. A bottomless pit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will the gentlemen be drinking something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring us a bottle of wine, to toast. The waiter leaves them. Slowly, Judit begins to walk the plank that will plunge her into anxiety. The evening feels far from a party, but she doesn't want to spoil it for either Mateo or Diego. She hears Mateo explaining to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found out about this place in the newspaper and I wanted to check it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a German idea, there are various restaurant like this one, they're totally in fashion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Can't believe what she's hearing.) Darkness, in fashion? I don't understand. Silence. Judit pours herself some water and drinks. And she gets depressed, in silence. She lights a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . "NO VIEWS" RESTAURANT. AT THE TABLE. INT. NIGHT. 2008. Javier, the waiter, arrives with the wine. He tells Judit she can't smoke. She puts out the cigarette. (On the floor?) To enliven the occasion, Diego proposes a toast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's toast!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Let's toast. Mateo pours the glasses. They each grab one. Clumsily, they bring them close until they can her the sound of the crystal clinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy Birthday!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy Birthday! We must look into each other's eyes. (She has already said it and it's too late when she thinks of retracting it.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we're kind of screwed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, sorry... It slipped. They attempt to clink glasses. It is not such an easy task. The three glasses head for each other in the darkness, it would have been easiest to have all three meet at the center, but instead each opts to find the other. Only Mateo puts his forward and leaves it in place, waiting for the other two to find his. When this happens, Judit's glass collides with too much force, breaks his glass and wine spills
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: all over the table cloth. Mateo attempts to make light of the situation, as if nothing had happened. He presses his fingers into the wine that has spilled on the tablecloth and exclaims:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joy! Joy! (to Judit) Bring your ear to me so that I can sprinkle some wine behind it. It's for good luck! Judit attempts to heed his request, she leans forward, offering her head, parallel to the table. Mateo can't quite find her ear. Judit collapses. Her head topples onto the table, without strength, and she bursts into tears. Cut to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . "THE MIRROR" TERRACE. INT. EXT. NIGHT. 2008. Show both terraces, the exterior one and the glass-enclosed one. The sequence begins once all three of them (Judit, Diego and Harry) are seated and drinking. Judit's emotional state has not improved. The short sequence of events that she's had to live through since her arrival have been making her increasingly tense and worried. She is trying to combat the letdown by way of gin-and-tonic. (They are sitting on one extreme of the ellipsis that makes up the glass-enclosed terrace, decorated with cheesy Deco motifs). At the center, where the bar is located, two or three waiters prepare to clean up the tables. Once in a while, they look over at the only three remaining clients. Once in a while, they are also able to catch Judit's words. And once in a while, the waiters function as the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: audience, witnessing a theatrical production. Although on this occasion, the setting is real and so is the drama. Judit sips-down the gin-and-tonic quite rapidly. Mateo and Diego accompany her. Cut to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED. MIRROR TERRACE. INT. NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you've been talking about these past days... A topic which they have waited to broach since she arrived from her trip. Neither of the two men respond, but they are both made uncomfortable by the comment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I do know what I haven't talked to you about all these years... Mateo directs his face toward her, surprised and polite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never asked you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you must have asked yourself a thousand times. This is my birthday gift, Mateo. (To Diego) The gift is also for you, Diego.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She takes another sip to draw courage, but she's already gathered enough momentum:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (To Mateo) After you disappeared, Ernesto Senior thought only of his revenge. A plan had occurred to him but, to carry it out, he had to bribe, at the very least, both Luis and me. It wasn't an issue, we both sold ourselves without hesitation. Luis and I. With me, he had the courtesy to provide an alibi, he proposed that I leave for a month and a half to the United States, to the Mayo Clinic, so that Diego could undergo a cure for his aspergillosis, that way I wouldn't have to be present while he destroyed the movie (because that was his plan, to make a mess out of the film). I opted to stay in Madrid and have Diego undergo his cure here. I wanted to witness everything. If I was going to betray you, I wanted to pay the full price...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a living hell! For both of you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said it! She takes a deep breath and continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. It was torture to watch Ernesto select the worst takes of each shot and Luis edit them together, turning your film into a monster (briefly tears?). The only way of withstanding that was to suffer more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Overcome) I sold myself to Ernesto because of my pain and jealousy. I couldn't take it and I couldn't (then) forgive you for having abandoned Cinearte with Lena without saying a word! My betrayal was my revenge against you, against her and against myself... The only innocent one was Diego... (To Diego) Forgive me, my son, for the bitterness that you've had to absorb all these years... no one deserves to grow up like this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED. MIRROR TERRACE. INT. NIGHT. Judit rises. She approaches the bar table. She orders another gin- and-tonic. The waiter doesn't dare to tell her they've already closed, so he serves her. With the glass in her hand, Judit returns to the table where Mateo and Diego wait, expectantly. She has observed them whispering, but she hasn't heard what they have said. She sits down with them. Judit takes a sip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Interrupts her) Don't continue, Judit! It's not necessary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Now that you once again call yourself Mateo, I have no excuse. Judit takes a sip from her drink, to gather her strength.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one knew where you were. We had no idea. Ernesto Senior put everything together, the premier, all that ruckus, to see if you'd react. His revenge was pointless if neither of you found out about it. (Pauses) Ernesto asked me constantly if I knew where you were, but I said that I also didn't know anything, which was true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Somber) That's why I never called you, but even if you don't believe it, I was very worried for you and the boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe you... Diego attempts to say that he, too, believes him, but Judit doesn't give him time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ernesto hired various detectives to search for you, but before they found you, you called me, two days after the premier. (Slowly, debilitated.) I was too embarrassed to answer, and... too stunned. I still am. When Ernesto Senior asked me again about you, I don't know why, I gave him the phone number for Famara... Mateo and Diego listen to her, with renewed attention. This new information reveals an unexpected possibility, something that neither of the two men had considered. Their reaction toward Judit's painful declaration changes in character. In Mateo's case, his compassion vanishes and is replaced by doubt, now incited by new suspicions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ernesto sent his son to find you in Lanzarote. (Images of Ernesto Junior, inside a rented car, following the couple across various places on the island, including the highway that leads to Famara, on that last night.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was the one who found you after the accident and called the hospital...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did he have something to do with the accident?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! But I can't stop thinking that had I not given his father the phone number, perhaps nothing would have happened...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Dryly) Why do you think that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Categorically) If you don't know, then stop torturing yourself. He says this with spite and somewhat disparagingly. For Judit it's like a splash of cold water to the face. The confession, rather than ending as a liberating catharsis, has devolved in its opposite. The silence is weighed down by suspicion and the new abyss between Mateo and Judit. Never before has Judit felt Mateo this distant and antagonistic. Her dramatic confession, far from liberating her, has opened new wounds
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and generated new suspicions. And Judit feels taken over by an arid anxiety, corrosive, unbearable. She almost can't breathe. Cut to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CASTELLANA STREET. EXT. NIGHT. 2008. Judit, Mateo and Diego are inside Judit's car. Diego is driving. The three are tense and silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MATEO'S BUILDING. EXT. INT. NIGHT. 2008. In silence, they arrive at the entrance of the building where Mateo lives. (Mateo is possibly carrying his umbrella or a blind man's cane). He exits the car. Judit walks him to the front door. She is glad that Mateo can't see her look of embarrassment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Destroyed) Good night. Call me if you need anything... Mateo doesn't respond. When the entrance door shuts like a resounding "no." Judit waits until she sees him disappear into the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MATEO'S DOORWAY. EXT. NIGHT. 2008.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From Judit's point of view, Mateo disappears into the elevator, which soon begins to rise.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: IN FRONT OF THE ENTRANCE TO MATEO'S BUILDING

direction.raw_text: . STREET. IN FRONT OF THE ENTRANCE TO MATEO'S BUILDING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. 2008. Undone, and she no longer pretends otherwise, Judit returns to the car. Before she opens the door she bends over and retches violently. Diego gets out of the car and holds her by the waist. He attempts to help her. Judit's face is contorted. She wipes a thread of saliva still hanging from her lips. Despite the retching, she has not vomited anything other than liquid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Touching her forehead) You are sweating...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a panic attack... (Takes a deep breath, as if she had lost her wind) Hand me the purse! Diego finds the purse in the car and hands it to her immediately. Judit searches through the purse, impatiently. She takes the purse and drops all of its contents on the sidewalk. She find a box of tranquilizers. The pill she presses through the aluminum seal comes out with a pop; she places it on her tongue. She leans over the car. Diego looks at her, scared, he has never seen her like this. Articulating poorly, so as to not move her tongue, Judit say to him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This will pass soon...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JUDIT'S HOME. INT. NIGHT. 2008. Diego hands her a glass of water. Once in bed, Judit takes two sleeping pills. She has overcome the crisis. Diego looks at her, very concerned. His mother has never shown herself to be so physically fragile. He wants to help her, but it doesn't seem like there is anything more he can do than what he already has. Judit attempts to smile in order to calm him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will sleep well with this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want me to stay here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Surprised) Here? What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In case the panic returns, so that you don't feel alone. Judit eyes swell with tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. I am feeling better... and I'll fall asleep soon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me, if you are not feeling well...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kisses her twice and exits. The curtains that cover a large window that looks out into an interior terrace are made from the same material as those that Mateo has in his bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HARRY'S HOME. INT. DAWN. 2008. The next day. Standing over his desk, Mateo searches the desk drawer under the computer. It's open. There are not many things inside (credit cards, envelopes with money, a jump drive, the MP3, etc.), he goes through it meticulously until he finds the note that Ray X had left him the day he came to ask him if they could write a script together. Ray X has hand-written his own telephone number on the note. He goes over it with his fingertips, as if he could see through them. He dials a familiar number, Diego's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JUDIT'S HOME. DIEGO'S BEDROOM. INT. DAWN. 2008. Diego's mobile phone vibrates four or five times. But Diego is sleeping and he doesn't wake up. The mobile phone stops vibrating. In all the scenes where Mateo is alone at home, he never turns on the light. He will be in the dark, lightly illuminated by any light that the cracks in the windows let through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mateo leaves him a message: "I am sorry to call you so early. Tell your mother to call me as soon as she can."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HARRY'S STREET. EXT. DAY. 2008. As usual, Mateo buys his newspaper at the same news-agent. He turns his body toward the Modeling Agency, but no one there enters or exits whose odor or whose clacking heels rings familiar. There are a few people on the sidewalk and those he crosses are all heading, like zombies, to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BAR ACROSS. 8 IN THE MORNING. EXT. INT. DAY. 2008. He enters the bar where his Waiter Friend works. The place has just opened. There are very few clients. He greets him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why here so early?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't sleep. Would you mind dialing this number? He hands him the phone and the piece of paper where Ray X's number is written.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN, JUDIT'S HOME. INT. DAY. 2008.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diego is meticulously preparing breakfast for himself and Judit. He works hard to ensure that they both start their day with the help of a generous and varied breakfast, toast, juice, coffee and tea, marmalade, toasted bread spread with oil and tomato, etc.. Judit appears through one of the kitchen doors, calm, with a look of having rested (but also with the hangover of having survived a nightmarish day, the day before). Diego does not hear her approach. The mother takes advantage of this to observe her son with a tender smile. When Diego turns to look, the tenderness disappears a little, more out of modesty and a lack of habit. In any case, Judit enjoys the peacefulness of the moment: her son caring for her after the storm. Judit looks over the culinary display.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How impressive!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am specializing in breakfasts. I would do the same for Mateo... Judit's expression changes, now a bit more somber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you OK?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, (still a bit beaten down) don't worry about last night. It's horrible, but it only happens occasionally and I know how to stop it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It scared me, it seemed as though an alien would pop out of your stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not a bad way of describing a panic attack... (Changing the topic, one can tell she's made the decision before she arrived in the kitchen). Diego, there was one last thing I didn't tell you yesterday. Assuming it will be painful, he attempts to dissuade her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About Mateo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can tell me some other time. Now it's time for breakfast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I don't tell you now, I may never do so... At the end of the eighties, in `77, to be exact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The year of punk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, in the year of punk, Mateo and I became involved...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a love affair?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... We were just getting started in film, and we are still at it, but our love affair ended, at least on his side... That didn't keep us from working together... until now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew all that, or I imagined it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's one more thing... Mateo is your father...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diego looks at her, astonished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that fleeting lover, my supposed biological father? You made him up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... I... can hide things... but I never make things up... I don't know how to make up... The fleeting lover existed, he was gay and our affair was short-lived. His name was Vicente and it was while I was with him that you were conceived, but your biological father was Mateo, not Vicente. Still thinking about what he has just heard, Diego places the breakfast on the main kitchen table and serves his mother a cup of tea. Judit begins to drink it, one tiny sip at a time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Assimilates the news. He is not displeased) Does Mateo know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. At that time, he asked me and I denied it, of course. I didn't want to put pressure on him, I didn't want our relationship to change because of it. After all, I had never asked him if he wanted to become a father. The pieces begin to fall together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you think I made a mistake, don't tell me now. We have the rest of our lives for recriminations. Diego remains pensive for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will not recriminate you... I think I like being Mateo's son (the son of a bitch) ... Speaking of, he called early this morning...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mateo. At 8h. She looks at the clock and it's 11h.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did he want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For you to call him as soon as you could.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Surprised, tense) That I call him? Why in the world have you not awakened me?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because, after what happened last night, you needed to sleep. He didn't say it was urgent. You can call him now. Judit grabs her son's phone, agitated once again, and dials Mateo's number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ALTERNATING BETWEEN JUDIT'S HOME. INT. DAY. 2008.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PUERTA DE HIERRO MANSION. ERNESTO JUNIOR'S STUDY. INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 2008. In the beginning the shot is close up and so we are not aware of where he is. All one can see is a bit of a curtain, out of focus. Phone conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Attempts to appear calm, since her confession her voice has a less authoritarian edge and is weaker) Diego has told me to call you. Are you OK? Do you need anything? (This is what she's most worried about.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Almost with irony) I am not alright, Judit. And yes, I do need something... The forty thousand meters of negative we shot during my last film in order to edit it... I am at the home of Ernesto Junior and I just found out the material was destroyed in '94. I imagined something like this, I just didn't think it would have happened that soon...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (With urgency) Let me explain...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Cuts her off) No. I am in a hideous mood, Judit, and I don't want to take it out on you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Surprised and alarmed) What are you doing at Ernesto's house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shot opens up, and we discover Ernesto Junior at the other end of the room, next to a 16mm camera (on a tripod) recording everything that Mateo says and does, while he searches around in some drawers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I am going to bribe him. We need money, I don't want Diego back at that damn bar. I want to pay Diego a salary, we need money and he has money to throw...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PUERTA DE HIERRO MANSION. ERNESTO'S STUDY. INT. DAY. 2008. The studio has a different configuration than when his father lived, but we recognize the place nonetheless; when the father was alive the space served a different purpose. Ernesto looks at Mateo fearlessly, he is still determined to search, urgently, for something inside the drawers of a chest. The place is a pretty big mess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mateo, stop talking crazy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is not craziness. I can't think of anyone else to blame for Magdalena's death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God! (She asks Diego to bring her the box of tranquilizers.) Wait a second... I have something to tell you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let it be, you already said enough last night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (She takes a pill and yells at him) Listen to me, Mateo! (As she raises her voice, she becomes dominant.) I was the production director, if you want to know anything about the footage, ask me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since you insist, I will ask you. What do you have to tell me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In effect, Ernesto Senior asked for it to be destroyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In '94! Very shortly after the release of that aberration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. In any case, sooner or later the lab disposes of all the material... and that was many years ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not anything that I don't already know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the film's producer I was the only one who had access to the lab... to all the material. After I gave the order to have everything destroyed, I intercepted it. And I kept it. I have all of it at home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are lying to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't tell you this last night because I didn't realize you wanted to edit it. I took everything, all the double takes, the internegative, the sound tapes... Everything! You can have it whenever you want! The silence on the other end of the line reassures her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That changes everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Begs) Please, get out of that place, leave Ernesto alone. He had nothing to do with this. Mateo looks over at Ernesto Junior. The camera is still on its tripod, rolling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am not so sure. He has yet to explain what he was doing in Lanzarote. I'll let you go, it seems he wants to talk... (Hangs up) Ernesto, finally, finds a DVD. He has it in his hand and brings it toward Mateo. (His hand enters into view on the screen of the 16mm camera).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Here is a copy of "the making of".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And why would I want that? I can't watch it! Plus, I'm not interested. Ernesto takes his hand and places the DVD softly onto it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Have someone you trust watch it and tell you about it. (This DVD proves that I wasn't responsible for the accident.) Oh, and even if my father had asked me to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: harm you, I never would have... You are very important to me, Mateo... Ernesto speaks naturally, for the first time, Mateo takes him seriously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MATEO-HARRY HOME. INT. DAY. 2008 Diego is watching the images of "the making of", while Mateo works out on his treadmill. At the last moment, an instant prior to being struck by the SUV, Mateo and Lena kiss inside the car. They are then distracted by a noise from the car that is about to hit them. These images have been recorded from inside a different car, which has been following them from behind, at a safe distance (Ernesto Junior's car). Mateo reaches the living room from the other end of the house, dripping with sweat. Diego has just watched the kiss and the accident. He rewinds and he pauses right at the moment when Mateo's and Lena's kiss fills the whole screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there something new I should know about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Surprised and moved) It's a very interesting documentary... And, yes, in effect, Ernesto followed you to Lanzarote, until the last moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The images are there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those of the last night? They take a look at the images that Ernesto taped at "El Mirador" from the outside. Through the glass of the large window we see Lena and Mateo talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. He recorded you at a safe distance, while you were on you way back after dinner. The scene is lit by the light of his headlights. It's not a lot, but enough to see what happened. Not only did he not have anything to do with the accident, he saved your life. Mateo watches the screen of the television without being able to see it, taking in the information Diego gives him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And one more e thing: When you were at the traffic circle, before the SUV crashed into to you, you and Lena kiss...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A kiss? I don't remember it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was an ordinary kiss, just one more of the many kisses a couple gives each other, almost without thinking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Pensive) The last kiss...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Even if it sounds cheesy, someone has to tell you: Lena did not die in your arms, as you dreamed, but the last sensation she experienced in this world was the taste of your mouth... Mateo watches without seeing the television, he gets close to the screen. With his fingertips, he caresses the surface, literally touching Lena's last kiss. Shots of Mateo's hand caressing the screen, with the image of the kiss. Shot of Diego observing the entirety of the scene, moved. A shot of everything. The appropriate kind of music accompanies the scene as it begins to fade out, bit by bit, while a sign appears:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ON THE AVID. INT. 2008 Luis' notebook, open on given sequences, as if Luis were present on this last moment of the definitive editing. An ashtray with a lit cigarette. The hands of the editor powering the Avid, directing the mouse through all the necessary steps until the screen fills with a block of sequences of "Girls and Suitcases," in Pina's loft. The images fill the entire screen of the main narration. It begins with the same sequence Diego and Mateo watched on television. Everything is the same, but it plays completely differently. The actresses are funny and fresh. The spectator does not know what the difference is, but, unconsciously, he must feel enthralled by the sequences of Pina and Chon, as if spellbound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENES FROM "GIRLS AND SUITCASES." PINA'S LOFT. ENTRANCE HALL. INT. 2008 Pina limps (fed up) toward the door. Looks through the peephole, behind it, Chon. They are good friends, but Chon is the last person Pina wants to see right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Whispers.) What a drag! (She opens, not the least bit welcoming.) Oh, it's you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Anxious, reproachful.) I have left you a thousand messages!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. A thousand from you and none from Ivan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Looks at the suitcase as if it were a menacing, strange bug.) What about this suitcase!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Ivan's. He's leaving me. She notices that Pina is wearing a cast on her leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that cast on your leg?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His ex-wife, the crazy one. She pushed me down the stairs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we're in good shape! I've also broken up with my husband...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, sorry to hear it! I will make some coffee, I have spent my entire night looking for Ivan and I haven't gone to bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neither have I. On her way to the kitchen Chon notices, through the bedroom door, that the bed has been burnt. She bumps into the phone that has been ripped out of its socket, now on the floor. She says nothing, she doesn't want to pry, but she thinks that Pina's situation must be more complicated than hers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LOFT'S KITCHEN. INT. 2008 The chickens are living large, free to roam throughout the entire place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did you leave him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four days ago. I could see it coming. The thing is that after breaking up, I go out onto the street and I notice there is this "guy" looking at me. She also discovers the gazpacho on the kitchen table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Voracious.) Oh my, gazpacho! Can I have a bowl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! I've spiked it with an entire box of downers...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In case Ivan arrived, he loves gazpacho.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Scolds her.) Pina, my God! Throughout the conversation Pina makes coffee and prepares a tray of Fornassetti cups and the whole bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's not all! Since he wasn't calling, I've torn the phone from the wall, in a moment of rage...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've tripped on the thing, but I didn't want to pry... And the bed? I think I noticed it smoking a bit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dropped a lit match and it began to burn, and I didn't want to squelch it. Fire purifies. I will have to change the mattress, but all for the best! A whole lot of less memories! Chon looks at her friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But excuse me, I've interrupted you. You were telling me... She grabs the tray, now full with coffee and pastries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's have breakfast on the terrace. The two women head for the terrace, which sits in front of the beautiful backdrop curtain of Madrid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LOFT'S TERRACE. INT. 2008 Chickens and rabbits, running around. Lots of plants, etc. An idyllic and false image. Only the feelings are authentic and the women's happy disposition for living in hysteria.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Struggling with what she's about to say.) Yes. I was telling you that I also have a suitcase at home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your husband's?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. It's a suitcase with fifteen kilos of cocaine, uncut. Pina's eyes open wide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've become a dealer, Chon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! How could you think that! I am still a Counselor for Social Affairs in the City Hall! The suitcase appeared in my closet. Imagine the scandal if the police find out. They could put me in jail!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to get rid of those fifteen kilos as soon as possible. (Thinks.) Because of the hours we keep, politicians consume a lot of drugs. So, between my party cohorts and city hall, I could distribute two kilos, but what do I do with the rest!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Throw it out!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you crazy? How could I throw it out?! I have to keep the police from finding it in my house... I have to take it some other place, immediately!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I don't understand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Interrupts.) Well, it's clear, honey!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Finishes her question.) How is it that the suitcase appeared in your closet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Drinks a little coffee, and takes a bite from a pastry.) As I was telling you, after breaking up with my husband, I bumped into this guy on the street who kept watching at me, good-looking, well hung. Summing up, I took him home and screwed him over and over... (Takes another sip of coffee.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An how was he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In bed? Divine. Look at my arm hair? I've got goose-bumps! (She shows her the hair on her arm,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: standing straight up.) He's that kind of guy who knows how to drive a woman mad with pleasure!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you lost your mind...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What else could I do?! So he asked me if he could stay at my place for a few days and I said OK, but I couldn't promise anything. I didn't want him thinking that I was that easy. So (breathes in) he brought the suitcase. He asked me if I cared if he kept it in the closet. He said that he was attached to the suitcase. And, well, why would I care?! (breathes in) By pure chance, I am watching TV last night and I find out that the police have nabbed him in the course of a drug sting operation and that he is one of the most wanted traffickers! I open the suitcase and I discover that it is filled with little bags of cocaine. I ran out of the house and I haven't returned since... Pina breathes out in solidarity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a story, my God!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Concluding.) I was wondering why he was such a good fuck! For men living in such high-stakes conditions, each fuck could be the last! (She reaches her arm out, again.) Look, the goose-bumps! Once again, she shows Pina her arm, hair standing straight up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've seen them already... They comes easy for you... (Changing topic.) And the suitcase?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Humble.) I was going to ask you... if you didn't mind that I brought it here. If they find it in my house, well, it's not about what could happen to me, but that it's just not an ideal situation for the Counselor of Social Affairs. Imagine how upset the mayor would be, and my party! My party can't take one more scandal! The doorbell rings:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The police!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shush, how could it be the police?! No one knows you're here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am a woman who attracts attention, Pina. Since I was a little girl...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just pretend you're here for coffee... Pina limps toward the door, uncertain. (Behind it she will find new adventures). She looks back, toward Chon, half-smiling, tired but charming, filled with understanding and a love for life, with all its emotions and its contradictions. It's with this half-smile on Magdalena's face that the sequence arrives at its end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AVID ROOM. INT. 2008 215 Mateo, Judit, Diego, and the new editor, somewhat removed from them, are seated in front of the editing table, they are both moved and entertained.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is hilarious!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Wants to be sure.) It doesn't sound like what we watched on TV, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not at all! This is a whole different thing! Judit is the one who is most deeply moved. She may cry, but this time her tears will be happy tears, welcome tears.
direction.name: direction
